title: COMPOUND SUBJECTS (AND / OR / NEITHER‚Ä¶NOR / EITHER‚Ä¶OR)
paragraphs: üü¶ STEP 1 ‚Äî BASIC CARD (DEFINITION CARD)
‚≠ê MODULE 0.2.5 ‚Äî COMPOUND SUBJECTS
Subjects Joined by AND / OR / NEITHER‚Ä¶NOR / EITHER‚Ä¶OR
ENGLISH (Main Explanation)
Compound subjects are subjects made of two or more nouns joined by connectors like [ORANGE]and[/ORANGE], [BLUE]or[/BLUE], [GREEN]neither‚Ä¶nor[/GREEN], [PURPLE]either‚Ä¶or[/PURPLE].
BREAK
With [ORANGE]AND[/ORANGE] ‚Äî the verb is usually plural because it refers to more than one person or thing.
Example ‚Äî Maria [ORANGE]and[/ORANGE] Ana work together. (Maria + Ana = plural ‚Üí work)
Example ‚Äî The teacher [ORANGE]and[/ORANGE] the student are talking. (plural)
BREAK
With [BLUE]OR[/BLUE] ‚Äî the verb matches the subject that is closest to it.
Example ‚Äî The teacher [BLUE]or[/BLUE] the [UNDERLINE]students[/UNDERLINE] are ready. (students = nearest ‚Üí plural)
Example ‚Äî The students [BLUE]or[/BLUE] the [UNDERLINE]teacher[/UNDERLINE] is ready. (teacher = nearest ‚Üí singular)
BREAK
With [PURPLE]EITHER‚Ä¶OR[/PURPLE] ‚Äî the verb follows the subject nearest to it.
Example ‚Äî [PURPLE]Either[/PURPLE] the teacher [PURPLE]or[/PURPLE] the [UNDERLINE]students[/UNDERLINE] are ready. (students = nearest ‚Üí plural)
Example ‚Äî [PURPLE]Either[/PURPLE] the students [PURPLE]or[/PURPLE] the [UNDERLINE]teacher[/UNDERLINE] is ready. (teacher = nearest ‚Üí singular)
BREAK
With [GREEN]NEITHER‚Ä¶NOR[/GREEN] ‚Äî the verb also follows the subject nearest to it.
Example ‚Äî [GREEN]Neither[/GREEN] the bags [GREEN]nor[/GREEN] the [UNDERLINE]box[/UNDERLINE] is heavy. (box = nearest ‚Üí singular)
Example ‚Äî [GREEN]Neither[/GREEN] the box [GREEN]nor[/GREEN] the [UNDERLINE]bags[/UNDERLINE] are heavy. (bags = nearest ‚Üí plural)
BREAK
Key idea ‚Äî For OR, EITHER‚Ä¶OR, and NEITHER‚Ä¶NOR, always look at the noun nearest the verb and match that number.
üåè TRANSLATIONS
‚≠ê HILIGAYNON
Ang compound subjects amo ang duha ukon mas madamo nga nouns nga ginadugtong sang [ORANGE]and[/ORANGE], [BLUE]or[/BLUE], [PURPLE]either‚Ä¶or[/PURPLE], [GREEN]neither‚Ä¶nor[/GREEN].
Kon [ORANGE]AND[/ORANGE] ‚Äî kasagaran plural ang berbo kay duha ukon mas madamo ang ginarefer.
Halimbawa ‚Äî Maria [ORANGE]and[/ORANGE] Ana work together. (plural)
Kon [BLUE]OR[/BLUE]/[GREEN]NOR[/GREEN] ‚Äî ang berbo naga-sunod sa pinakamalapit nga noun.
Halimbawa ‚Äî [PURPLE]Either[/PURPLE] the cats [BLUE]or[/BLUE] the dog is hungry. (dog = singular)
‚≠ê CEBUANO
Ang compound subjects kay duha o mas daghang nouns nga giila sa [ORANGE]and[/ORANGE], [BLUE]or[/BLUE], [PURPLE]either‚Ä¶or[/PURPLE], [GREEN]neither‚Ä¶nor[/GREEN].
Kung [ORANGE]AND[/ORANGE] ‚Äî plural ang berbo kay labaw sa usa ang nagahimo.
Pananglitan ‚Äî Maria [ORANGE]and[/ORANGE] Ana work together. (plural)
Kung [BLUE]OR[/BLUE]/[GREEN]NOR[/GREEN] ‚Äî mosunod ang berbo sa noun nga pinakaduol niya.
Pananglitan ‚Äî [GREEN]Neither[/GREEN] the bags [GREEN]nor[/GREEN] the [UNDERLINE]box[/UNDERLINE] is heavy. (box = singular)
‚≠ê TAGALOG
Ang compound subjects ay binubuo ng dalawa o higit pang pangngalan na pinag-uugnay ng [ORANGE]and[/ORANGE], [BLUE]or[/BLUE], [PURPLE]either‚Ä¶or[/PURPLE], [GREEN]neither‚Ä¶nor[/GREEN].
Kapag [ORANGE]AND[/ORANGE] ‚Äî pangmaramihan ang pandiwa dahil higit sa isa ang paksa.
Halimbawa ‚Äî Maria [ORANGE]and[/ORANGE] Ana work together. (plural)
Kapag [BLUE]OR[/BLUE]/[GREEN]NOR[/GREEN] ‚Äî ang pandiwa ay sumusunod sa pinakamalapit na pangngalan.
Halimbawa ‚Äî [PURPLE]Either[/PURPLE] the teacher [BLUE]or[/BLUE] the students are ready. (students = plural)
‚≠ê KAPAMPANGAN
Ing compound subjects makiaduang nouns o masalese a maki-ugnayan king [ORANGE]and[/ORANGE], [BLUE]or[/BLUE], [PURPLE]either‚Ä¶or[/PURPLE], [GREEN]neither‚Ä¶nor[/GREEN].
Nung [ORANGE]AND[/ORANGE] ‚Äî plural ing verb uling dakal la ring paksa.
Halimbawa ‚Äî Maria [ORANGE]and[/ORANGE] Ana work together. (plural)
Nung [BLUE]OR[/BLUE]/[GREEN]NOR[/GREEN] ‚Äî lawen me ing noun a makasumunod king verb; iya ing desisyunuen.
Halimbawa ‚Äî [GREEN]Neither[/GREEN] the bags [GREEN]nor[/GREEN] the [UNDERLINE]box[/UNDERLINE] is heavy. (box = singular)
‚≠ê ILOKANO
Ti compound subjects ket dua wenno ad-adu a nouns a naggugurayan babaen ti [ORANGE]and[/ORANGE], [BLUE]or[/BLUE], [PURPLE]either‚Ä¶or[/PURPLE], [GREEN]neither‚Ä¶nor[/GREEN].
No [ORANGE]AND[/ORANGE] ‚Äî agbalin plural ti berbo ta adu dagiti paksa.
Kas pangrugian ‚Äî Maria [ORANGE]and[/ORANGE] Ana work together. (plural)
No [BLUE]OR[/BLUE]/[GREEN]NOR[/GREEN] ‚Äî ti berbo sumurot iti kadakkel a nauding a noun (ti asideg iti berbo).
Kas pangrugian ‚Äî [PURPLE]Either[/PURPLE] the cats [BLUE]or[/BLUE] the [UNDERLINE]dog[/UNDERLINE] is hungry. (dog = singular)
